str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A head of a household. From oikos and despotes; the head of a family.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 2nd Person Singular
str2: Yours, thy, thine. From su; thine.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
